result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth E. CLARK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Methamphetamine Precursors as repeater [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.65.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture Methamphetamine as repeater

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with the sentence presently being served on 13 CF 195.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No association with any known drug dealers or users.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Knowingly Solicit, Direct, Use Another Person to Purchase Pseudoephedrine as repeater

Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-04-14 at 3:00 p.m.  Plea date is set for 05-19-14 at 11:30 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-24-14 at 3:00 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail furnished.
